revision.text:
{{Infobox person |name = Pär Olof Sandå |image = File:Pär Olof Sandå.jpg |caption = Par Sanda at North Beach Village Resort |birth_name = {{nowrap|Pär Olof Sandå}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1965|6|22}} |birth_place = [[Bjärred]], [[Skåne County]], [[Sweden]] |occupation = Investor, Hotelier }} '''Par Sanda''' (born June 22, 1965) is a [[Sweden|Swedish]] [[entrepreneur]], developer and stock trader. His accomplishments include establishing the Pan Capital Group, also known as Pan Capital Aktiebolag, an international stock market trading company and redeveloping the ''North Beach Village'',<ref name="developing the North Beach Village">[http://www.bizjournals.com/southflorida/print-edition/2013/02/15/developers-breathe-new-life-into-north.html?page=all Developers breathe new life into North Beach Village], ''South Florida Business Journal'' Website</ref><ref name="Investors adding to its North Beach Village resort collection">[http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2013-10-24/business/fl-lauderdale-north-beach-village-resort-update-20131022_1_fort-lauderdale-beach-par-sanda-hotel-operator Investors adding to its North Beach Village resort collection], ''Sun Sentinel'' Website</ref><ref name="Pair of investors buying up property off Fort Lauderdale beach">[http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2011-03-14/business/fl-hotel-lauderdale-buyup-20110309_1_escape-hotel-small-hotels-par-sanda Pair of investors buying up property off Fort Lauderdale beach], ''Sun Sentinel'' Website</ref><ref name="Developer looks to turn North Beach area into urban village">[http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2011-07-19/news/fl-north-beach-development-20110719_1_north-beach-par-sanda-courtney-crush Developer looks to turn North Beach area into urban village], ''Sun Sentinel'' Website</ref><ref name="Fort Lauderdale seeks to transform dated North Beach community">[http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2011-12-07/news/fl-new-shops-on-the-beach-20111207_1_swedish-investor-par-sanda-north-beach-courtney-crush Fort Lauderdale seeks to transform dated North Beach community], ''Sun Sentinel'' Website</ref> an area of 1950’s mid-century hotels and resorts in [[Fort Lauderdale, Florida]].
==Biography== Sandå was born in [[Bjärred]], a coastal [[urban areas of Sweden|locality]] located in [[Lomma Municipality]], [[Skåne County]], [[Sweden]]. In 2010 it had a population of 9,542. It is located roughly 20 km north of [[Malmö]] and 10 km west of [[Lund]]. He was raised by his mother, father and has one younger sister. He attended Lund University ({{lang-sv|Lunds Universitet}}) where he received a bachelor's degree in economics.<ref name="euro-scholars">[http://www.euroscholars.eu/universities/lund.htm Lund University, Sweden] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140914025518/http://www.euroscholars.eu/universities/lund.htm |date=2014-09-14 }}, ''Euro Scholars'' Website</ref><ref name="solander">[http://www.solander.lu.se/LU.html Lund University], ''The Solander Program'' Website</ref><ref>[http://www.lunduniversity.lu.se/about-lund-university About Lund University]</ref><ref>[http://www.topuniversities.com/university-rankings/world-university-rankings/2012 World University Rankings 2012]</ref><ref>[http://www.topuniversities.com/university_rankings/results/2008/overall_rankings/fullrankings/ Top 200 Universities], Website of ''QS Top Universities''</ref><ref>[[Shanghai Jiao Tong University]]'s [[Academic Ranking of World Universities]] - [http://ed.sjtu.edu.cn/rank/2007/ARWU2007_Top100.htm 2007] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070824164927/http://ed.sjtu.edu.cn/rank/2007/ARWU2007_Top100.htm |date=2007-08-24 }}, [http://ed.sjtu.edu.cn/rank/2006/ARWU2006_Top100.htm 2006] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071023181108/http://ed.sjtu.edu.cn/rank/2006/ARWU2006_Top100.htm |date=2007-10-23 }}, [http://ed.sjtu.edu.cn/rank/2005/ARWU2005_Top100.htm 2005] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120806070354/http://ed.sjtu.edu.cn/rank/2005/ARWU2005_Top100.htm |date=2012-08-06 }}</ref><ref>[http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/14321230/ The Complete List: The Top 100 Global Universities]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timeshighereducation.co.uk/world-university-rankings/2010-2011/top-200.html |title=Top 200 - The Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2010-2011 |publisher=Timeshighereducation.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2012-04-20}}</ref> While Sandå has a successful and attention-drawing career history, he makes it a point to stay out of the spotlight for the sake of his and his family’s privacy. {{Citation needed|reason=Reliable source needed for the whole sentence|date=August 2015}}. Par Sandå was recently named as one of the 40 hottest Swedes in the US right now <ref>{{cite web|url=https://nordic.businessinsider.com/here-are-the-40-hottest-swedes-in-the-us-right-now-2017-10/ |title=40 hottest Swedes in the US right now |publisher=businessinsider.com |date= |accessdate=2017-10-26}}</ref>
==The Pan Capital Group== Upon graduation from Lund University, Sandå commenced his professional career in the financial world as an institutional broker at [[Stockholm]] Brokerage. His strengths and prowess were recognized early, especially by trading director Bo Mattsson. When Mattsson was recruited to [[Swedbank]] in 1990, he brought Sandå with him as an institutional broker with the intention to further develop Sandå’s potential and talent.
During his employment at Swedbank, Sandå and colleague Bengt Larsson attended Tony Saliba’s trading school in Chicago for three months in 1991. The knowledge Sandå gained here greatly influenced the success he went on to experience. Sandå and Larsson returned to Swedbank and commenced building the trading department. The duo expanded to include Claes-Henrik Julander, Henrik Hedman, Magnus Hedman, Fredrik Landin, and Richard Warneker. The close-knit group’s practice of aggressive trading brought the company increased market share as well as earnings.
In September 1996, the group joined Rivus, a subsidiary of Oresund, but after building up the company, Sandå and the group moved on to a new partner. The group’s next partnership began in 1997 with [[Erik Penser]], Swedish financier and businessman. The group established Pan Capital in 1998 and their joint venture with Penser resulted in earning Penser a very healthy profit. Their relationship lasted until 2009 when the partners split up and Pan Capital <ref name="Beyond the Swedish financial miracle">[http://www.affarsvarlden.se/hem/nyheter/article2593557.ece Beyond the Swedish financial miracle], ''Affärsvärldens'' Website</ref> became independent.
The company now has offices in Stockholm and Florida.<ref name="Hotels and trading attracts Pan Capital to Florida">[http://www.va.se/nyheter/2013/01/28/hotell-och-trading-lockar-pan-capital-till-florida/ Hotels and trading attracts Pan Capital to Florida], ''Veckans Affärer'' Website</ref> Pan Capital is extremely private about its business practices and tries to keep out of the public eye.{{Citation needed|reason=Reliable source needed for the whole sentence|date=August 2015}} According to [[Affärsvärlden]], a Swedish business magazine, “the company is a member of several of the world's major stock exchanges, with about 95 per cent of their transactions are made outside Sweden.”
In September 2013, Pan Capital, along with 22 other investment firms were charged with "violating a rule that prohibits firms from shorting a stock within a five-day window of a public offering, and then buying the same security through the offering."<ref name="U.S. SEC charges 23 firms in short-sale crackdown; 22 settle">[https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/09/17/us-sec-shortselling-idUSBRE98G0TP20130917 U.S. SEC charges 23 firms in short-sale crackdown; 22 settle] ''Reuters''</ref> Pan Capital settled the charges and agreed to pay back profits made from the stock and the fines to the [[United States Department of the Treasury]] which totaled over $660,000.<ref name="ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDING File No. 3, 15492 In the Matter of PAN CAPITAL AB">[https://www.sec.gov/litigation/admin/2013/34-70409.pdf ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDING File No. 3, 15492 In the Matter of PAN CAPITAL AB] ''[[U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission]]''</ref>
==The North Beach Village== In 2010, during the recession,<ref name="Fort Lauderdale hotels avoid foreclosure as Sanda shells out $5M">[http://www.bizjournals.com/southflorida/blog/morning-edition/2013/04/fort-lauderdale-hotels-avoid.html Fort Lauderdale hotels avoid foreclosure as Sanda shells out $5M], ''South Florida Business Journal'' Website</ref><ref name="Fort Lauderdale site auctioned for 76% off mortgage">[http://www.bizjournals.com/southflorida/news/2011/04/13/fort-lauderdale-site-auctioned.html Fort Lauderdale site auctioned for 76% off mortgage], ''South Florida Business Journal'' Website</ref><ref name="Fort Lauderdale’s Seaside Villas bought at $7M discount">[http://www.bizjournals.com/southflorida/news/2012/01/27/fort-lauderdales-seaside-villas.html Fort Lauderdale’s Seaside Villas bought at $7M discount], ''South Florida Business Journal'' Website</ref> Pan Capital looked into alternative investments and turned to South Florida’s real estate market. the company purchased over 35 properties <ref name="North Beach Village Resort properties">[http://www.sun-sentinel.com/business/sfl-northbeachvillageresortgallery-20131025,0,2254852.photogallery North Beach Village Resort properties], ''Sun Sentinel'' Website</ref><ref name="North Beach Village development could turn area around">[http://www.bizjournals.com/southflorida/blog/2013/02/nborth-beach-village-slideshow.html North Beach Village development could turn area around], ''South Florida Business Journal'' Website</ref> on Fort Lauderdale’s barrier island in what will come to be known as the North Beach Village, gathering them under the umbrella of the North Beach Village Resorts. The village's title comes from the name of the zoning district: North Beach Residential Area.
Most of the properties purchased by Pan Capital are 1950’s mid-century modern hotels and resorts. Sandå <ref name="Pär becomes obsessed and learn all about it">[http://www.va.se/nyheter/2013/01/28/par-blir-helt-besatt-och-lar-sig-allt-om-det/ Pär becomes obsessed and learn all about it], ''Veckans Affärer'' Website</ref> is redeveloping the area, renovating and updating the properties one by one, re-opening them as distinctive boutique hotels, each with their own personality and theme. Acquisitions include: TropiRock, The Winterset Suites, Robindale Suites, North Beach Village Hotel, The Grand Palm Plaza, Hotel Lush Royale, La Casa Resort, Royal Palms Resort and Spa,<ref name="Nation's 1st full-service gay resort opens in Lauderdale">[http://www.sun-sentinel.com/business/sfl-full-service-gay-resort-opens-in-lauderdale-05092011,0,4458532.story Nation's 1st full-service gay resort opens in Lauderdale], ''Sun Sentinel'' Website</ref> The Aqua Hotel, The Plaza Bistro, Tara Hotel, Tranquilo Hotel, Cocobelle Resort, and The Beach Gardens Hotel. The North Beach Village Resorts offer a mixture of accommodations catering to families and singles in addition to [[LGBT tourism]] travelers.
The work in progress is intended to be a pedestrian friendly European-style village area where visitors and locals alike can stroll along streets lined with art galleries, cafes, and retail shops. Sandå wishes to make the cornerstones of this project - peace, love and happiness - evident in all facets of the North Beach Village. Construction <ref name="Building boom underway in Fort Lauderdale Beach ">[http://www.local10.com/news/building-boom-underway-in-fort-lauderdale-beach/27672424 Building boom underway in Fort Lauderdale Beach], ''Channel 10'' Website</ref> is expected to be complete in the coming years.
==External links== * [http://www.pancapital.com/ Pan Capital Group Official site] * [http://www.northbeachvillageresort.com/ North Beach Village Resort Official site]

{{BLP sources|date=August 2018}} {{pp-pc1}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox officeholder |name = Raja Pervaiz Ashraf
{{small|{{Nastaliq|راجہ پرویز اشرف }}}} |image = |order = [[List of Prime Ministers of Pakistan|19th]] |office = Prime Minister of Pakistan |president = [[Asif Ali Zardari]] |deputy = [[Chaudhry Pervaiz Elahi]] |term_start = 22 June 2012 |term_end = 24 March 2013 |predecessor = [[Yousaf Raza Gillani]] |successor = [[Mir Hazar Khan Khoso]] |office1 = [[Minister for Water and Power (Pakistan)|Minister for Water and Power]] |primeminister1 = [[Yousaf Raza Gillani]] |term_start1 = 31 March 2008 |term_end1 = 9 February 2011 |predecessor1 = [[Liaquat Ali Jatoi]] |successor1 = [[Syed Naveed Qamar]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1950|12|26|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Sanghar]], [[Sind Province (1936-55)|Sind]], [[Pakistan]]
|death_date = |death_place = |party = [[Pakistan Peoples Party]] |alma_mater = [[University of Sindh]] |spouse = Nusrat Pervaiz Ashraf |children = 4 |occupation = [[Agriculturist]], [[Business]] |religion = [[Islam]] |website = }} '''Raja Pervaiz Ashraf''' ({{lang-ur|{{Nastaliq|راجہ پرویز اشرف}}}}; born 26 December 1950), is a [[businessman]], [[agriculturist]], and [[politician]] who served as 19th [[Prime Minister of Pakistan]] from 22 June 2012 until completing his designated term on 16 March 2013.{{cite news|title=Raja Pervez Ashraf declared new Pakistani PM|url=http://dawn.com/2012/06/22/parliament-begins-new-pm-election/|accessdate=22 June 2012|newspaper=[[Dawn (newspaper)|DAWN]] |date=22 June 2012}}{{cite web |url=http://www.pmo.gov.pk/former_pms.php|title=FORMER PRIME MINISTERS |publisher=pmo.gov.pk}} He currently resides in Sanghar House,[[ Gujar Khan Tehsil|Gujar Khan]]. Prior to be elevated as Prime minister, he previously served as the [[Minister for Water and Power (Pakistan)|Minister for Water and Power]] in the [[Yousaf Raza Gillani]]-led government from March 2008 to February 2011.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2008\04\01\story_1-4-2008_pg1_5 |title=24-member federal cabinet takes oath|newspaper=[[Daily Times (Pakistan)|Daily Times]]| first=Sajjad|last=Malik|accessdate=1 April 2008}} A senior-ranking leader in the [[Pakistan Peoples Party]] (PPP) from [[Rawalpindi District]], Ashraf assumed premiership on 22 June 2012 after Yousaf Raza Gillani was disqualified over [[contempt of court]] charges. Shortlisted by the PPP as a candidate for the post, he was eventually elected based on a 211–89 vote in the National Assembly. Tackling the corruption scandals, one of the major achievements during his premiership was his interest to develop and implement hydro projects in particular Neelum-Jhelum project of 970 MW. The project had received a big jolt when the Chinese Exim Bank refused to release $448 million loan linking it to the restoration of the Safe City Project in Islamabad which has been stopped by the Supreme Court of Pakistan.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-13-20043-Rs24-bn-diverted-to-Neelum-Jhelum-project |title=Rs24 bn diverted to Neelum-Jhelum project|work=[[The News International]]|date=6 January 2013|accessdate=7 January 2013}} During his tenure [[Water and Power Development Authority]] (WAPDA) had launched a number of mega and medium-sized projects in [[Gilgit–Baltistan]].{{cite news|url=http://pakobserver.net/detailnews.asp?id=198920 |title=PPP govt pursuing multi-pronged strategy for GB development|work=[[Pakistan Observer]]|date=6 March 2013|accessdate=7 March 2013}} ==Personal life and childhood== Raja Pervaiz Ashraf was born on 26 December 1950 in [[Sanghar]], interior [[Sindh]]. He graduated from the [[University of Sindh]] in 1970 and was involved in agriculture before entering politics.{{cite news| url=http://dawn.com/2012/06/22/profile-raja-pervaiz-ashraf/|title=Profile: Raja Pervaiz Ashraf|newspaper=[[Dawn (newspaper)|DAWN]]|accessdate=23 June 2012}} He is married to Nusrat Pervaiz Ashraf{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/437401/celebrating-culture-theres-no-shame-in-wearing-a-hijab/|title=There’s no shame in wearing a hijab|work=[[The Express Tribune]]|date=16 September 2012|accessdate=18 September 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2012%5C09%5C16%5Cstory_16-9-2012_pg7_11|title=First lady urges women to wear hijab|work=[[Daily Times (Pakistan)]]|date=16 September 2012|accessdate=18 September 2012}} and has four children, which include two sons and two daughters. Ashraf belongs to the [[Minhas]] clan of Pakhral and is originally from [[Gujar Khan]], an industrial town in the [[Rawalpindi District]] of the [[Pothohar Plateau|Potohar region]] in northern [[Punjab, Pakistan|Punjab]].{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-06-22/pakistan/32368519_1_power-project-energy-minister-sindh|title=Who is Raja Pervez Ashraf?|work=The Times of India|date=22 June 2012|accessdate=5 July 2012}} The Potohar region is home to numerous prominent political and military personalities.{{cite web|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-2-116171-Barren-Potohar-the-cradle-of-leaders-good-and-bad|title=Barren Potohar, the cradle of leaders, good and bad|work=The News}}{{cite web|author=Anita Joshua|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/international/article3559911.ece|title=Manmohan, new Pak PM from same region|work=The Hindu}} Ashraf comes from a middle class [[Potwari language|Potohari-speaking]] family of landowners who have had a traditional background in politics. An uncle of his served as a minister in the cabinet of [[Ayub Khan (Field Marshal)|Ayub Khan]] during the 1960s.{{cite web|url=http://dawn.com/2012/06/22/with-ashrafs-nomination-potoharis-secure-key-posts-in-country/|title=With Ashraf’s nomination, Potoharis secure key posts in country|work=Dawn|date=22 June 2012|accessdate=29 December 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://dawn.com/2012/06/23/illustrious-sons-of-potohar-2/|title=Illustrious sons of Potohar|work=Dawn|date=4 May 2012}} His parents owned agricultural land in the town of Sanghar in [[Sindh]], where he was Born and brought up.[http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2012%5C06%5C23%5Cstory_23-6-2012_pg7_22 Raja Pervez Ashraf: the new leader], Daily Times. Ashraf is [[Multilingualism|multilingual]] and can fluently speak [[English language|English]], [[Urdu language|Urdu]], [[Punjabi language|Punjabi]] and [[Pothohari dialect|Potwari]] and [[Sindhi language|Sindhi]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-18552145|title=Profile: Raja Pervez Ashraf|publisher=BBC News|date=22 June 2012|accessdate=11 July 2012}} ==Political career== He is regarded as an important PPP loyalist and leader in the Rawalpindi region. He contested parliamentary elections in 1990, 1993 and 1997. He won in elections held in 2002 and then in 2008, following which he was appointed as federal minister for water, and as power minister in the cabinet of Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gillani. [[File:PPP-Hoarding.JPG|thumbnail|Raja Ashraf on a hoarding]] ===Member of Parliament=== Ashraf has been twice elected Member of the [[National Assembly of Pakistan]] (MNA) from his constituency of [[Gujar Khan]], Rawalpindi District. He won re-election in the [[Pakistani general election, 2008|February 2008 elections]]. During his time as an MNA, he served as a member of the Standing Committee on Kashmir and the Standing Committee on Law, Justice and Human Rights. Before his ascendance to the post of prime minister, he was also the secretary general of the PPP.{{cite web|url=http://www.infopak.gov.pk/primeminister.aspx|title=Raja Pervez Ashraf|work=[[Ministry of Information and Broadcasting (Pakistan)]]|accessdate=5 June 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120616033558/http://www.infopak.gov.pk/primeminister.aspx|archivedate=16 June 2012|df=dmy-all}} ===Water and Power ministry=== He became the head of the [[Ministry of Water and Power (Pakistan)|Water and Power Ministry]] in the coalition government of [[Pakistan Peoples Party|PPP]], [[Pakistan Muslim League (N)|PML-N]], [[Awami National Party|ANP]], [[Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam|JUI-F]] and [[Muttahida Qaumi Movement|MQM]] formed after the 2008 elections.{{cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/2008/03/29/top1.htm|title=Parties finally clinch deal on key ministries|first=Amir|last=Wasim|newspaper=DAWN|accessdate=29 March 2008}} During his tenure as power minister, there was a chronic shortage of electricity generation throughout the country and power cuts ([[load shedding]]) remained frequent. In the position, he faced heavy criticism for repeatedly promising the country's power crisis would be over "by 2008" as the country suffered regular blackouts. He became one of the most sought after ministers in the National Assembly, by legislators who demanded answers for the power crisis.{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/398379/as-water-and-power-czar-ashraf-was-the-most-sought-after-minister-in-na/|title= As water and power czar, Ashraf was the most sought after minister in NA|work=The Express Tribune|date=24 June 2012|accessdate=11 July 2012}} According to a report on his parliamentary performance, the water and power ministry while Ashraf was in-charge received as many as 1,147 official questions and queries, of which only 60% were responded to. The report opined that Ashraf's performance as minister was "tainted by failures to overcome the power shortfall that continued to aggravate even after he was replaced" and that his actions and responses both inside and outside the National Assembly had "not been translated into actions" Nevertheless, about 3,570 megawatts of power was added to the national grid during the PPP government, a major portion of which came during Ashraf's term in office. His term is said to have overseen relatively more megawatts being added to the national grid when compared to other ministers of power and energy since [[Benazir Bhutto]]'s last government. He was accused of receiving kickbacks in the rental power projects, and of using illegal money to buy foreign property. Ashraf denied the charges, and as of June 2012, was defending himself before the [[Supreme Court of Pakistan|Supreme Court]]. No official charges have been framed against him as no evidence could be presented so far. One of the main reasons for power crisis, which have never received due attention and focus is the circular debt and which continued to increase over the years. The government has time and again tried to clear the circular debt, however it comes again. This is because of the structural issues including power theft, poor recovery from other government departments, difference between cost of generation and actual cost charged to customer.{{cite news|url=: [https://www.economist.com/blogs/banyan/2012/05/pakistan’s-energy-crisis] |title=Pakistan’s energy crisis Power politics|work=[[The Economist]]|date=21 May 2012|accessdate=22 May 2012}} During Ashraf`s government prioritised hydro power projects in particular Neelum Jhelum 970 MW. During his term, WAPDA initiated several hydro projects in Gilgit Baltistan (GB) including the Satpara Dam having 17 MW power generation capacity and 0.093 million acre feetwater storage capacity and Diamer-Bhasha Dam having 4,500 MW power generation capacity and 8.1 million acre feet water storage capacity, along with hydropower projects of 7,100 MW Bunji, 34 MW Harpo, 80 MW Phandar and 40 MW Basho. Hydro power is the cheapest energy source and as Minister and PM he gave special attention, however hydro power projects take long time to complete and the electricity from the projects will be available after 10 years. In order to resolve short term energy crisis, Ashraf implemented power project on rental basis, following the rental policy approved in Mushrrafs tenure. However the projects became controversial. ==Prime Minister of Pakistan== ===Early days=== On 26 April 2012, Prime Minister [[Yousaf Raza Gillani]] was convicted of being in contempt of court for refusing to bring charges against President [[Asif Ali Zardari]]. On 19 June 2012, Gillani was retroactively ruled ineligible to hold the office by the Supreme Court. The ruling [[Pakistan People's Party]] nominated textile minister [[Makhdoom Shahabuddin]] to replace Gillani, but the nomination failed when the [[Anti-Narcotics Force]] issued a warrant for Shahabuddin's arrest on drug charges. Ashraf was then selected as the party's next option. On 22 June 2012, Raja Pervez Ashraf was elected [[Prime Minister of Pakistan|Prime Minister]] of [[Pakistan]] by a 211–89 vote.{{cite news| url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/pakistan/Raja-Pervez-Ashraf-elected-new-PM-of-Pakistan/articleshow/14342856.cms| title=Raja Pervez Ashraf elected new PM of Pakistan| newspaper=[[The Times of India]]| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120622181805/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/pakistan/Raja-Pervez-Ashraf-elected-new-PM-of-Pakistan/articleshow/14342856.cms| archivedate=22 June 2012| df=dmy-all}} Ashraf and his cabinet were sworn in on the same day.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/article-55575-Raja-Parvaiz-Ashraf-and-federal-cabinet-to-take-oath-tonight|newspaper=[[The News International]]|title=Raja Pervaiz to be sworn in tonight| date=22 June 2012}} His selection as Prime Minister restored the country's government after several days of turmoil where officially the country was without a government.{{cite news|title=Raja Pervaiz Ashraf Is Pakistan's New Prime Minister|author=Rebecca Santana|author2=Chris Brummitt|author3=Zarar Khan|date=22 June 2012|agency=Associated Press|work=Huffington Post|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/06/22/raja-pervaiz-ashraf-pakistan-prime-minister_n_1618675.html|accessdate=23 June 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120803061417/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/06/22/raja-pervaiz-ashraf-pakistan-prime-minister_n_1618675.html|archivedate=3 August 2012|df=dmy-all}} The [[Associated Press]] said Ashraf's election was "unlikely to calm the tensions roiling the country" and noted that many observers expected him be eventually be ousted like his predecessor. Political analyst Raza Rumi said Ashraf was likely chosen by the PPP because they knew he would not last long. On 24 July 2012, the Government informed the Supreme Court, one day before expiry of the court's deadline, that it has not taken a decision on reopening of the graft cases against President Zardari.{{cite news| url= http://www.indianexpress.com/news/after-gilani-ashraf-defies-pak-sc-order-to-reopen-case-against-zardari/978742/0|title= After Gilani, Ashraf defies Pak SC order to reopen case against Zardari|date= 24 July 2012}} ===Socioeconomic challenges=== Immediately after his election, Ashraf said that the economy, inflation, and the country's power crisis would be his top concerns. "Our country cannot afford politics of confrontation at this time," he said. Within 24 hours of being elected, Ashraf held a meeting to resolve the energy crisis in the country and directed the Ministry of Petroleum to ensure the supply of 28,000 tonnes of fuel daily to power plants, so as to add 1200 mega watts to the national grid system.{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/398102/first-task-prime-minister-ashraf-calls-conference-on-energy-crisis/|title=Ensure 28000 tonnes per day fuel to power plants: Ashraf|work=The Express Tribune|date=23 June 2012|accessdate=24 June 2012}} There were power protests erupting throughout the country for continual load shedding.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-7-118582-Power-protesters-block-roads-as-PM-visits-Peshawar|title=Power protesters block roads as PM visits Peshawar|work=The News|date=5 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} The [[Pakistan Economy Watch]] (PEW) was critical of this renewed focus on energy, calling it a "useless effort" with the president of PEW, Murtaza Mughal, remarking that load shedding had only "increased in the harrowing summer", making life difficult for the ordinary citizen; Mughal further noted that the announcement of adding more fuel into independent power producers had been portrayed positively, despite the fact that the actual problem did not lie in scarcity of fuel but rather in non-payment of dues.{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/403718/energy-woes-pms-efforts-unproductive-says-pew/|title=Energy woes: PM’s efforts unproductive, says PEW|work=The Express Tribune|date=5 July 2012|accessdate=5 July 2012}} Businesspeople and economists in Pakistan had a mixed response to Ashraf's appointment; while some appreciated the prime minister's focus on the energy crisis and hoped for greater cooperation between key institutions and political parties as being good for economic stability, others questioned his reputation related to rental power and expressed anxiety over the government's ongoing clash with the judiciary which could cause uncertainty and scare businesses away. A government official praised the smooth transition of power and said that the country's economic policy would stay the same, adding that the government's economic team will carry on with implementing the [[2012 Pakistan federal budget|budget]] and other economic functions as present before Gillani's disqualification.{{cite news|url=http://www.gulf-times.com/site/topics/article.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=516508&version=1&template_id=41&parent_id=23|title=Business community expects no wonders from PM Raja|work=[[Gulf Times]]|date=3 July 2012|accessdate=5 July 2012}} As an initiative to overcome the energy crises, Ashraf announced his intention to build several small dams across the country. He said that these projects would start from his native Potohar plateau, as part of a development programme for the Potohar region.{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/405258/pm-ashraf-wants-small-dams-to-meet-power-needs/|title=PM Ashraf wants small dams to meet power needs|work=The Express Tribune|date=8 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} Apart from energy, he identified the deteriorating law and order situation of Karachi, especially with regards to [[Target killings in Karachi|target killings]], as a second major challenge.{{cite news|url=http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2012/06/26/news/national/energy-karachi-security-major-challenges-pm/|title=Energy, Karachi security major challenges: PM|work=[[Pakistan Today]]|date=26 June 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} In September 2012, during his maiden trip to [[Gilgit-Baltistan]], Ashraf announced a [[Pakistani rupee|Rs.]] 2 billion development package for the region.{{cite web|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/444249/pm-announces-rs2b-package-for-g-b/|title=PM announces Rs2b package for G-B|date=29 September 2012|work=The Express Tribune|accessdate=31 January 2016}} On 12 July 2012, The Supreme Court in its NRO implementation case order has ruled that Prime Minister Raja Pervaiz Ashraf must write the letter to Swiss authorities to reopen graft cases against President Asif Ali Zardari.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/article-58528-SC-orders-PM-Ashraf-to-write-letter-|title=SC orders PM Ashraf to write letter|work=The News International|date=12 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} On 25 July 2012, The Supreme Court gave Raja Pervaiz Ashraf to 8 August 2012 to implement its order by writing a letter to Swiss authorities to reopen graft cases against President Asif Ali Zradari.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/article-60410-NRO-Implementation:-SC-orders-PM-Ashraf-to-write-letter-by-August-8|title=NRO: PM ordered to write letter by Aug 8|work=The News International|date=25 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} On 8 August 2012, the supreme court adjourned the hearing till 18 September 2012 ===Political developments=== Three days after his election, Ashraf visited [[Nine Zero]] and met with leaders of the [[Muttahida Qaumi Movement]] in Karachi. He also visited the leader of the [[Pakistan Muslim League (F)]]. The visits were seen as part of a fresh move to reaffirm ties with coalition political parties.{{cite news|url=http://dawn.com/2012/06/25/pm-ashraf-visits-nine-zero-kingri-house-during-karachi-visit/|title=PM Ashraf visits Nine Zero, Kingri House during Karachi visit|work=Dawn|date=25 June 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} The first significant milestone Ashraf performed after taking charge of his office was an approval for the creation of a post of [[Deputy Prime Minister of Pakistan]] to fulfill a demand of the coalition party [[Pakistan Muslim League (Q)]] (PML-Q). The post was inaugurated on 25 June and [[Chaudhry Pervez Elahi]] of PML-Q was appointed as the first deputy prime minister of the country.{{cite news|url=http://dawn.com/2012/06/25/demands-fulfilled-15-ministries-granted-to-pml-q/|title=PML-Q’s demands fulfilled; Elahi made Deputy PM, 15 ministries granted|work=Dawn|date=25 June 2012|accessdate=26 June 2012}} However, the position is largely symbolic and has no legal constitutional duties. On 27 June 2012, the [[Supreme Court of Pakistan]] gave prime minister Ashraf two weeks to indicate whether he would ask Swiss authorities to reopen [[corruption]] cases against president Zardari.{{cite news|url=http://pakobserver.net/detailnews.asp?id=162193|title=SC wants Swiss letter by PM in two weeks|work=[[Pak Observer]]|date=28 June 2012|accessdate=15 January 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Ayl4EWFi?url=http://pakobserver.net/detailnews.asp?id=162193|archivedate=27 September 2012|df=dmy-all}} However, Ashraf stated that his position on the issue was no different from that of previous prime minister Gillani.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2012%5C06%5C27%5Cstory_27-6-2012_pg7_2|title=Petition filed against new PM over Swiss letter|work=Daily Times|date=27 June 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} In the first week of July, he directed attention on the [[Balochistan conflict]] and called for a high-level meeting to discuss the issue of [[Missing persons (Pakistan)|missing persons]] in the province.{{cite news|url=http://dunyanews.tv/index.php?key=Q2F0SUQ9MiNOaWQ9ODgwNDU=|title=High-level meeting on missing persons’ issue today|work=Dunya News|date=3 July 2012|accessdate=5 July 2012}} In the first week of July, Ashraf announced the government's plans to establish legislation which would remove the bar on dual nationality holders from contesting in elections. If passed, the legislation would enable [[Overseas Pakistanis]] holding dual nationalities eligible to participate in elections and hold public office. The enforcement of such a legislation remains a controversial issue.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2012%5C07%5C02%5Cstory_2-7-2012_pg1_3|title=Govt will bring law to allow dual nationals contest elections: PM|work=Daily Times|date=2 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} He made a visit to [[Peshawar]] a few days later, where he met local politicians, during which he expressed his views on the parliament being "the mother of all institutions".{{cite news|url=http://www.nation.com.pk/pakistan-news-newspaper-daily-english-online/national/05-Jul-2012/parliament-is-the-mother-of-all-institutions-pm|title=Parliament is the mother of all institutions: PM|work=The Nation|date=5 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} He has praised the role of [[Democracy in Pakistan|democracy]] in creating an "independent media, judiciary and parliament." He further paid tribute to the [[Pakistan Army]] in its [[Pakistan's role in the War on Terror|role in the War on Terror]] and military operations in the troubled northwestern areas.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2012%5C07%5C11%5Cstory_11-7-2012_pg7_16|title=Independent media, judiciary, parliament fruits of democracy: PM|date=11 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} In the fraud case against [[Asif Ali Zardari]], he indicated in September 2012 that he would be willing to open the pending fraud cases.{{cite news|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/asia/2012/09/20129181154102792.html|title=Pakistan to 'reopen Zardari fraud cases' – Central & South Asia|publisher=Al Jazeera|date=18 September 2012|accessdate=15 January 2013}} ===Foreign policy=== When commenting on [[Foreign relations of Pakistan|foreign policy]] after assuming premiership, Ashraf said that he wanted to deal with the [[United States]] on "an equal footing". However, he will likely have to deal with the court's demands to charge Zardari before doing much else. [[Prime Minister of India|Prime Minister]] [[Manmohan Singh]] of [[India]] congratulated Ashraf shortly after his election, and anticipated greater progress in bilateral [[India–Pakistan relations|relations between the two countries]] during Ashraf's term.{{cite web|url=http://pmindia.nic.in/press-details.php?nodeid=1453|title=PM congratulates Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf|work=[[Prime Minister's Office (India)]]|date=22 June 2012|accessdate=5 July 2012}} The Chinese government greeted Ashraf and pledged [[China–Pakistan relations|closer ties with Pakistan]] to strengthen their "all-weather friendship".{{cite news|url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2012-06-25/news/32409313_1_yousuf-raza-gilani-ministry-spokesman-hong-lei-friendly-neighbour|title=China greets new Pakistan PM Raja Pervez Ashraf; pledges close partnership|work=The Economic Times|date=25 June 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} Other notable messages of congratulation came from U.S. Secretary of State [[Hillary Clinton]] and Afghan president [[Hamid Karzai]].{{cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/article-56909-Clinton-hopes-relations-will-improve-during-PM-Raja-Pervaiz's-tenure|title=Hillary Clinton calls PM Raja Pervaiz|work=Dawn|date=1 June 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://president.gov.af/en/news/10794|title=President Karzai Congratulates Pakistan’s New Prime Minister|work=Office of the President of Afghanistan|date=23 June 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} On 24 June 2012, several [[Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan|Tehrik-i-Taliban]] militants from Afghanistan entered Pakistan's [[Durand Line|bordering]] [[FATA|tribal areas]] killing 13 Pakistani troops, of which seven were beheaded. During the conflict, Pakistani troops killed fourteen of the raiding militants. The attack, one of several such [[Afghanistan–Pakistan skirmishes|cross-border skirmishes]], was strongly condemned with Raja Pervaiz Ashraf stating that the matter would be directly taken to Afghan president Hamid Karzai.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jun/26/militants-behead-pakistani-troops-afghanistan|title=Militants 'behead Pakistani troops after crossing border from Afghanistan'|work=The Guardian|date=26 June 2012|accessdate=11 June 2012}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/06/26/world/asia/taliban-kill-13-soldiers-in-pakistan-raid.html|title=Taliban Kill 13 Soldiers in Pakistan Raid|work=The New York Times|date=25 June 2012|accessdate=11 June 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/410064/cross-border-attacks-high-on-agenda-for-ashrafs-afghanistan-tour/|title=Cross-border attacks high on agenda for Ashraf's Afghanistan tour|work=The Express Tribune|date=18 July 2012|accessdate=19 July 2012}} Regarding his stand on the [[Kashmir conflict]] with India, Ashraf has categorically stated that Pakistan would continue providing moral, political, and diplomatic support to the [[Kashmiri people]] of [[Jammu and Kashmir]] until a solution was to be reached for the issue in accordance with UN resolutions and Kashmiri aspirations.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-07-06/pakistan/32565564_1_kashmir-issue-indian-counterpart-ranjan-mathai-india-and-pakistan|title=Pakistan to continue support to Kashmir cause: PM Raja Pervez Ashraf|work=The Times of India|date=6 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/410381/pm-ashraf-calls-for-resolving-tensions-with-india/|title=PM Ashraf calls for resolving tensions with India|work=The Express Tribune|date=19 July 2012|accessdate=19 July 2012|first=A. H.|last=Nizami}} Ashraf is expected to visit [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]], to hold talks with the Afghan leadership on the peace process in Afghanistan amidst the ongoing Afghan war and to discuss the status of Afghan-led reconciliation with the [[Afghan Taliban]]. The visit comes at a time when Pakistan's relations with the United States have improved in the aftermath of the 2011 NATO attack.{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/406063/pm-ashraf-to-visit-kabul-to-expedite-peace-efforts/|title=PM Ashraf to visit Kabul to expedite peace efforts|work=The Express Tribune|date=10 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} On 15 July, he performed a two-day state visit to [[Saudi Arabia]], his first official tour since becoming prime minister. During the visit, he would perform [[Umrah]], meet with King [[Abdullah of Saudi Arabia]], discuss the status of [[Pakistan-Saudi Arabia relations|relations between Pakistan and Saudi Arabia]] and also meet members of the [[Pakistanis in Saudi Arabia|Pakistani community in Saudi Arabia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.geo.tv/GeoDetail.aspx?ID=58966|title=GeoTV Geo News Latest News Breaking News Pakistan Live Videos|work=geo.tv|accessdate=31 January 2016}} On his visit to [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]], in late July 2012, Ashraf met with Karzai government officials and engaged in talks with the two main opposition leaders [[Abdullah Abdullah]] from the [[National Coalition of Afghanistan]] and [[Ahmad Zia Massoud]] from the [[National Front of Afghanistan]]. Among other things they discussed the need for increased and regular dialogue between leaders of Afghanistan and Pakistan.[http://www.etelaf-melli.com/contents.php?lang=fa§ion=interviews&id=591 Ashraf in Kabul] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130122154401/http://www.etelaf-melli.com/contents.php?lang=fa§ion=interviews&id=591 |date=22 January 2013 }} On 30 March, the apex court had directed the National Accountability Bureau to proceed against those who were in the post of minister for water and power from 2006 till the next general elections. As a result, on 20 April, NAB issued arrest warrants for 33 persons, including Ashraf.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenewstribe.com/2013/01/15/supreme-court-orders-to-arrest-prime-minister-raja-pervez-ashraf/ |title=Rental power case: Supreme Court orders to arrest Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf |publisher=The News Tribe |accessdate=2013-01-15}} ==Controversies== ===Arrest order=== On 15 January 2013, the [[Supreme Court of Pakistan]] ordered the arrest of Raja Pervaiz Ashraf for alleged [[Political corruption|corruption]] as Ashraf was accused of [[kickbacks]] from rental [[Power station|power plants]] that were part of a project intended to serve as part of the solution to Pakistan's power problems.{{cite web|last=Rodriguez|first=Alex|title=Pakistani Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf ordered arrested|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2013/jan/15/world/la-fg-pakistan-corruption-20130116|work=Los Angeles Times|accessdate=17 January 2013}} The media derided Raja Pervaiz Ashraf as ''Rental Raja''.[http://www.awaztoday.com/News-Talk-Shows/24470/Raja-Pervaiz-Ashraf-Raja-Rental-History.aspx Raja Pervaiz Ashraf ‘Raja Rental’ History] The arrest order came at the same time as the [[Long March (Pakistan)|Long March]] culminated in the national capital of [[Islamabad]]. None of the accused in the rental case has been convicted so far. The rental power case is pending with independent Supreme court for nearly four years and no conviction has been made. Ashraf has time and again demanded clearance of his name and denies all the charges. Ashraf in his appearance in the Supreme Court categorically denied such charges and offered his complete cooperation with all authorities and courts. A member of the ruling [[Pakistan People's Party]] referred to the arrest order as "a conspiracy" while Pakistan's interior minister [[Rehman Malik]], claimed that "Even after this order, (Ashraf) is the prime minister and, God willing, he will continue as prime minister."{{cite web|last=Habib|first=Nasir|title=Pakistani Supreme Court orders arrest of prime minister in corruption case|url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/01/15/world/asia/pakistan-politics/index.html|publisher=CNN|accessdate=17 January 2013|author2=Jethro Mullen }} The [[National Accountability Bureau|accountability court]] in Islamabad [[Indictment|indicted]] former [[Prime Minister of Pakistan|Prime Minister]] Raja Pervez Ashraf and six others in the rental power case on 16 January 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.nation.com.pk/islamabad/17-Jan-2014/raja-pervez-ashraf-indicted-in-rental-power-case|title=Raja Pervez Ashraf indicted in rental power case|date=17 January 2014|work=The Nation|accessdate=31 January 2016}} ===Nepotism=== Raja Pervez Ashraf appointed his son-in-law Raja Azeem in World Bank (Executive Director-Pakistan and others) in violation of rules and an example of Nepotism prevalent in Pakistani political elite.{{cite web|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/480045/pm-appoints-son-in-law-to-key-world-bank-post/|title=PM appoints son-in-law to key World Bank post|date=15 December 2012|work=The Express Tribune|accessdate=31 January 2016}} ==See also== {{Portal|Socialism|Biography|Punjab, Pakistan|Government of Pakistan}} *[[Socialism in Pakistan|Left-wing politics in Pakistan]] ==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== {{Sister project links|Raja Pervaiz Ashraf|wikt=no}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060127012942/http://www.pakistan.gov.pk/ Government of Pakistan] {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{s-bef|before=[[Liaquat Ali Jatoi]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Minister for Water and Power]]|years=2008–2011}} {{s-aft|after=[[Naveed Qamar]]}} |- {{s-bef|before=[[Yousaf Raza Gillani]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Prime Minister of Pakistan]]|years=2012–2013}} {{s-aft|after=[[Mir Hazar Khan Khoso]]

{{Infobox person | name = Roberto Justus | image = Roberto Justus CEO do Grupo Newcomm 1.jpg | imagesize = 200px | birth_name = Roberto Luiz Justus | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1955|4|30|df=y}} | birth_place = [[São Paulo]], Brazil | nationality = [[Brazilian people|Brazilian]] | known_for = [[Television]]: [[Rede Record]] and [[Sistema Brasileiro de Televisão|SBT]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = {{*}}Chairman and president of Grupo Newcomm
{{*}}Host of ''Roberto Justus +'' | networth = | parents = János Justus (father)
Lidia Justus (mother) | spouse = Ticiane Pinheiro (2006-2013) | children = 4 | website = }} '''Roberto Luiz Justus''' (born 30 April 1955) is a [[Brazilians|Brazilian]] businessman and television personality. ==Biography and career== Justus was born in [[São Paulo]], [[Brazil]], to a Jewish [[Hungarians|Hungarian]] immigrant family.{{cite news|url=http://g1.globo.com/sao-paulo/carnaval/2012/noticia/2012/02/rosas-de-ouro-vai-homenagear-povo-hungaro-no-anhembi.html|title=Rosas de Ouro vai homenagear povo húngaro no Anhembi|date=7 February 2012|publisher=G1|accessdate=22 January 2014}} He is best known for ''O Aprendiz'', which is the Brazilian version of [[The Apprentice (TV series)]]. He married Ticiane Pinheiro who is the daughter [[Helô Pinheiro]], a Brazilian socialite. The couple, who divorced in 2013, have one daughter, Rafaella.{{cite news|url=http://diversao.terra.com.br/gente/nao-tenho-trauma-de-casamento-diz-ticiane-pinheiro,809df60b92693410VgnVCM3000009af154d0RCRD.html|title="Não tenho trauma de casamento", diz Ticiane Pinheiro|date=15 January 2014|publisher=[[Terra Networks]]|accessdate=22 January 2014}} He hosts the TV show ''[[1 vs. 100|Um Contra Cem]]'' on [[Sistema Brasileiro de Televisão|SBT]] and ''Roberto Justus +'' on [[Rede Record|Record]]. Justus considered running for the presidency of Brazil in the [[Brazilian general election, 2018|2018 elections]],{{cite web|last=Pereira|first=Jonathan|date=2016-11-23|title=Roberto Justus explica possível candidatura a presidência em 2018 - Celebridades - iG|publisher=Gente|url=http://gente.ig.com.br/celebridades/2016-11-23/roberto-justus-presidente.html|language=pt-BR}}{{cite web|title=Roberto Justus admite possibilidade de disputar presidência do País|publisher=Estadão|url=http://politica.estadao.com.br/blogs/coluna-do-estadao/roberto-justus-admite-disputar-presidencia-em-2018/|language=pt-br}} but eventually abandoned the idea.{{cite web|url=http://www1.folha.uol.com.br/opiniao/2017/01/1853824-ser-ou-nao-ser.shtml|title=Ser ou não ser|author=Roberto Justus|publisher=Folha de São Paulo|date=29 January 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://veja.abril.com.br/blog/radar-on-line/roberto-justus-poe-projeto-politico-na-geladeira/|publisher=Veja|title=Roberto Justus põe projeto político na geladeira|author=Mauricio Lima|date=27 January 2017}} ==Discography== ;Studio Album * 2008: ''Só Entre Nós'' ==Single== * 2008: ''Can't Take My Eyes off You'' ==References== * {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{commons category}} *{{pt icon}} [http://exclusivo.terra.com.br/aprendiz2/interna/0,,OI593076-EI5248,00.html Quem é Roberto Justus? (''Who is Roberto Justus?'')], Terra.com.br {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Justus, Roberto}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1955 births]] [[Category:People from São Paulo]] [[Category:Brazilian people of Hungarian descent]] [[Category:Brazilian businesspeople]] [[Category:Brazilian television personalities]] {{Brazil-business-bio-stub}}

'''''SEMMA''''' is an acronym that stands for ''Sample'', ''Explore'', ''Modify'', ''Model'', and ''Assess''. It is a list of sequential steps developed by [[SAS Institute]], one of the largest producers of [[statistics]] and [[business intelligence]] software. It guides the implementation of [[data mining]] applications.<ref name="AzevedoSantos">Azevedo, A. and Santos, M. F. [http://www.iadis.net/dl/final_uploads/200812P033.pdf KDD, SEMMA and CRISP-DM: a parallel overview]. In Proceedings of the IADIS European Conference on Data Mining 2008, pp 182-185. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130109114939/http://www.iadis.net/dl/final_uploads/200812P033.pdf |date=January 9, 2013 }}</ref> Although SEMMA is often considered to be a general data mining methodology, SAS claims that it is "rather a logical organization of the functional tool set of" one of their products, SAS Enterprise Miner, "for carrying out the core tasks of data mining".<ref name="sasweb">[http://www.sas.com/offices/europe/uk/technologies/analytics/datamining/miner/semma.html/ SAS Enterprise Miner website] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120308165638/http://www.sas.com/offices/europe/uk/technologies/analytics/datamining/miner/semma.html/ |date=March 8, 2012 }}</ref>
==Background== In the expanding field of data mining, there has been a call for a standard methodology or a simply list of [[best practices]] for the diversified and iterative process of data mining that users can apply to their data mining projects regardless of industry. While the [[Cross Industry Standard Process for Data Mining]] or CRISP-DM, founded by the [[European Strategic Program on Research in Information Technology]] initiative, aimed to create a neutral methodology, SAS also offered a pattern to follow in its data mining tools.
==Phases of SEMMA== The phases of SEMMA and related tasks are the following:<ref name="sasweb"/> * '''Sample'''. The process starts with [[sampling (statistics)|data sampling]], e.g., selecting the data set for modeling. The data set should be large enough to contain sufficient information to retrieve, yet small enough to be used efficiently. This phase also deals with data partitioning. * '''Explore'''. This phase covers the understanding of the data by discovering anticipated and unanticipated relationships between the variables, and also abnormalities, with the help of [[data visualization]]. * '''Modify'''. The Modify phase contains methods to select, create and transform variables in preparation for data modeling. * '''Model'''. In the Model phase the focus is on applying various modeling (data mining) techniques on the prepared variables in order to create models that possibly provide the desired outcome. * '''Assess'''. The last phase is Assess. The evaluation of the modeling results shows the reliability and usefulness of the created models.
==Criticism== SEMMA mainly focuses on the modeling tasks of data mining projects, leaving the business aspects out (unlike, e.g., CRISP-DM and its Business Understanding phase). Additionally, SEMMA is designed to help the users of the SAS Enterprise Miner software. Therefore, applying it outside Enterprise Miner can be ambiguous.<ref name="RohanizadehMoghadam">Rohanizadeh, S. S. and Moghadam, M. B. [http://www.qjie.ir/?_action=showPDF&article=31&_ob=2e9f779810eaef02d9bcc00959616080&fileName=full_text.pdf A Proposed Data Mining Methodology and its Application to Industrial Procedures] Journal of Industrial Engineering '''4''' (2009) pp 37-50.</ref>
==See also== * [[Cross Industry Standard Process for Data Mining]]
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Applied data mining]]

{{Coord|54.852|N|83.105|E|display=title}}
'''Silicon Taiga''' is a [[nickname]] for [[Akademgorodok]], a [[Russia]]n research and development center that is located near [[Novosibirsk]]. The nickname is a reference to the [[Silicon Valley]], a renowned IT region found in [[Northern California]]. The term was first introduced to the Western press by [[Newsweek|Newsweek magazine]]<ref>Newsweek magazine, [http://www.newsweek.com/1999/05/02/better-spell-it-cyberia.html First mention of Silicon Taiga in press], May 03, 1999</ref> in 1999.
== Location ==
The town is situated partly on the [[Ob River|River Ob]], and partly on the shore of a [[Novosibirsk reservoir|Novosibirsk artificial reservoir]] that was created by a [[dam]] on the river. Informally, this reservoir is called the [[Ob Sea]]. The dam contains a large [[hydroelectric power plant]] that was constructed in the 1950s.
The town itself has no skyscrapers, and only one remote speedway connecting it to the city of Novosibirsk. Office buildings and residences are connected by many intertwined, footworn paths.
==History== In the 1950s the former [[Academy of Sciences of the USSR]] founded its Siberian Division, today known as the [[Siberian Division of the Russian Academy of Sciences]], with a center of [[scientific research]] in Akademgorodok, where they established a dozen research institutes. To keep institutes supplied with fresh minds, [[Novosibirsk State University]] (NSU) was founded by the resolution of the [[Council of Ministers of the USSR]] on January 9, 1958.
===Distinctive=== The distinctive feature of NSU is its system of competitive selection and its training of talented youth. NSU is the only university in Siberia to have developed a multilevel model of continuing education. The University was built and developed simultaneously with the Novosibirsk scientific center and is focused on training highly qualified specialists for scientific work and tutoring. Since its foundation in 1958, more than fifty thousand specialists graduated<ref>[http://www.topuniversities.com/university/463/novosibirsk-state-university NSU on QS World University Rankings] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101201141934/http://topuniversities.com/university/463/novosibirsk-state-university |date=2010-12-01 }}</ref> from Novosibirsk State University; more than six thousand have defended their [[PhD]] dissertations, and over one thousand five hundred have received [[doctor of science|doctoral degrees]]. In 2009, NSU achieved the status of a national research university. This high honor was granted by the [[Russian Government]] on a competitive basis for a period of ten years.
===Information Technology Outsourcing=== The first [[Information Technology Outsourcing|IT]] companies were established in Akademgorodok in the 1990s. After the collapse of the [[Soviet Union]], the government's investments into scientific activity were greatly reduced, and many scientists left long established institutions on a quest for better conditions. Some of these scientists decided to leave Russia in search of jobs in foreign scientific organizations all over the world. Others established their own [[private business]]es, which were [[software]]-related [[High tech|high-tech]] IT companies. Many of these companies grew up into large, internationally recommended providers of software products and services. Their strategy was simple: the new IT companies would adopt the tried and true principles of the already established, famous IT corporations.
All IT companies in the Silicon Taiga can be divided into the two categories according to the [[offshore programming]] [[business model]] they employ: The firms that provide [[Offshore Development Center]] (ODC), and mostly develop new custom products ([[New product development|NPD]]), and the firms that are oriented to the [[Software as a service|SAAS]] model. Meantime the global giants in the field of software and high-tech products, such as [[IBM]], [[Intel Corporation]], and [[Schlumberger]], saw this growing trend and established [[branch office]]s in the Silicon Taiga.
===Innovative technology park=== The summer of 2010 saw the launch of an innovative technology park<ref>[http://marchmontnews.com/story.php?story_id=9924&story=Novosibirsk%92s-Akademgorodok-eyes-$5m-nano-center Novosibirsk’s Akademgorodok eyes $5m nano-center]</ref> in Akademgorodok, which brought together economic and intellectual power in the area, thus expanding innovation in Russia. Today, the Silicon Taiga is not just a collection of IT companies; it is a beneficial environment, in which the Russian national system of innovations can continue to flourish.<ref name="Venture investment">{{cite web|author=Marya Smorgonskaya|url=http://www.marchmontnews.com/journals/viewJournal.php?articleId=233|title=Novosibirsk Modern Technologies Venture investment|work=MarchmontNews.com|publisher=Marchmont}}</ref>
== Companies and subsidiaries == The following is a partial list of past and present notable companies founded in the Silicon Taiga or which have a major [[subsidiary]] located there:
*[[Alawar Entertainment]]<ref>Erin Bell, [http://www.gamezebo.com/news/2010/08/17/alawar-entertainment-forms-sixth-internal-game-studio-30-releases-planned Alawar Entertainment forms sixth internal game studio], Aug 17, 2010</ref> *[[Arello Mobile]] *[[ATAPY Software]] *[[Axmor]] *[[Azoft]] *[[Baker Hughes]] *[[BCS-IT]] *[[Fortess]] *[[Hewlett-Packard|HP]] (By establishing HP’s International Institute of Technology in Novosibirsk State University)<ref>[http://h41131.www4.hp.com/uk/en/podcasts/IgorBelousov.html HP’s International Institute of Technology teaches real-life IT (June 2009)]</ref> *[[Intel Corporation]] *[[Novosoft]]<ref>[http://www.wireservice.ca/index.php?module=News&func=display&sid=3101 About Novosoft LLC.], Submitted on September 1, 2010</ref> *[[Parallels, Inc.|Parallels]]<ref>David Hamilton, [http://www.thewhir.com/web-hosting-news/082610_Software_Developer_Parallels_Officially_Expands_Strategy_to_Australia_and_New_Zealand Software Developer Parallels Officially Expands Strategy to Australia and New Zealand], August 26, 2010</ref> *[[Schlumberger]] *[[Sibers]]<ref>Press Release on PRLog, [http://www.prlog.org/10649478-sibers-is-listed-in-iaops-2010-global-outsourcing-100.html Sibers is listed in IAOP's 2010 Global Outsourcing 100], Apr 27, 2010</ref> *[[Velvetech]] *[[Vito technology]]<ref>Mike Schramm, [http://www.tuaw.com/2010/06/13/wwdc-2010-vito-technology-walks-on/ About Vito Technology's achievements] June 13, 2010</ref>
== References == {{Reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.academpark.com/ The Siberian Akadempark], a cradle of Russian high-tech innovations

page.title: Simulations and games in economics education

revision.comment: Added example of Macroeconomics simulation
revision.text:
{{Economics sidebar}} A [[simulation game]] is "a [[game]] that contains a mixture of [[game of skill|skill]], [[game of chance|chance]], and [[game of strategy|strategy]] to simulate an aspect of reality, such as a [[stock exchange]]". Similarly, Finnish author [[Virpi Ruohomäki]] states that "a simulation game combines the features of a game (competition, cooperation, rules, participants, roles) with those of a simulation (incorporation of critical features of reality). A game is a simulation game if its rules refer to an empirical model of reality."<ref name="Riis">{{cite book | author= Ruohomaki, V. | title= Viewpoints on Learning and Education with Simulation Games in Simulation Games and Learning in Production Management edited by Jens O. Riis | publisher= Springer | year=1995| id=ISBN O-412-72100-7 | pages = 14–28}}</ref> A properly built simulation game used to teach or learn [[economics]] would closely follow the assumptions and rules of the [[Model (economics)|theoretical model]]s within this discipline. __TOC__
==In economics education==
[[Economics education]] studies recommend the adoption of more active and collaborative learning methodologies (Greenlaw, 1999).<ref name="Greenlaw">{{cite journal | author = Greenlaw, S.A.| year = 1999| title = Using groupware to enhance teaching and learning in undergraduate economics | journal = Journal of Economic Education | volume = 30 (Winter) | pages =33–42 | doi = 10.2307/1183031 | issue = 1 | jstor = 1183031}}</ref> Simkins (1999) stated "… ''teaching practices, which rely heavily on the lecture format, are not doing enough to develop students' cognitive learning skills, attract good students to economics, and motivate them to continue coursework in the discipline.''" (p. 278).<ref name="Simkins">{{cite journal | author = Simkins, S.P.| year = 1999| title = Promoting active-student learning using the World Wide Web in economics courses| journal = Journal of Economic Education | volume = 30 (Summer) | pages =278–91 | doi = 10.2307/1183067 | issue = 3 | jstor = 1183067}}</ref> This is consistent with the results of a survey published in the American Economic Review by Allgood (2004) that shows that students "rarely take economics as a free elective – especially beyond principles." (p. 5).<ref name="Allgood">{{cite journal | author = Allgood, S.Bosshardt, W., Van der Klaauw, W., and Watts, M. | year = 2004| title = What Students Remember and Say about College Economics Years Later| journal = American Economic Review | volume = 94 | pages =259–65 | doi = 10.1257/0002828041301731 | issue=2}}</ref> More is needed to be done in the classroom to excite students about economics education.
Simulations supplement the standard lecture. Both computerized and non-computer based simulation and games show significant levels of growth in education (see Lean, Moizer, Towler, and Abbey, 2006;<ref name="Lean">{{cite journal | author = Lean, J., Moizer, M., Towler, C. A.| year = 2006| journal = Active Learning in Higher Education| title = Simulation and games | volume = 7 | pages =227–42 | issue=3 |url=https://hal.archives-ouvertes.fr/hal-00571951/document}}</ref> Dobbins, Boehlje, Erickson and Taylor, 1995;<ref name="Dobbins">{{cite journal | author = Dobbins, C. L., Boehlje, M., Erickson, S., and Taylor, R. | year = 1995| title = Using Games to Teach Farm and Agribusiness Management| journal = Review of Agricultural Economics| volume = 17 | pages =247–55 | doi = 10.2307/1349570 | issue = 3 | jstor = 1349570}}</ref> Gentry, 1990;.<ref name="Gentry">{{cite book | author= Gentry, J. | title= Guide to Business Gaming and Experiential Learning | publisher= ABSEL and Nichols/GP Publishing | year=1990| id=ISBN O-89397-369-6}}</ref>
==Example in monopolistic competition==
Through a simulation game, students may participate directly in a market by managing a simulated firm and making decisions on price and production to maximize profits. An excellent review of the use of a successful market simulation is given by Motahar (1994) in the Journal of Economics Education.<ref name="Motahar">{{cite journal | author = Motahar, E. | year = 1994| title = Teaching Modeling and Simulation in Economics: A Pleasant Surprise | journal = Journal of Economics Education| volume = 25 | pages =335–342 | doi = 10.2307/1182981 | issue = 4 | jstor = 1182981}}</ref>
A monopolistic competition simulation game can be used as an example in the standard economics classroom or for [[experimental economics]]. Economic experiments using monopolistic competition simulations can create real-world incentives that may be used in the teaching and learning of economics to help students better understand why markets and other exchange systems work the way they do. An explanation of experimental economics is given by Roth (1995). <ref name="Roth">{{cite book | author= Roth, A.E. | title= Introduction to experimental economics in The Handbook of Experimental Economics by Kagel, J.H. and Roth, A.E.| publisher= Princeton University Press | year=1995| pages = 3–109}}</ref>
'''Assumptions of monopolistic competition'''
A simulation game in [[monopolistic competition]] needs to incorporate the standard theoretical assumptions of this market structure, including: * Many buyers and sellers * Easy entry and exit * Some degree of product differentiation * Zero economic profits in the long-run
In a simulation of monopolistic competition, each firm must be small in size, and should not be able to influence the direction of the overall market. Yet each firm has some control over price owing to product differentiation. To be consistent with economic theory, the simulation model should allow entry of new firms to occur as long as profits are greater than normal, and economic profits exist. The entry of new firms will decrease the market price, and eventually cause economic profits to return to zero (see Baye, 2009).<ref name="Baye">{{cite book | author=Baye, Michael | title= Managerial Economics and Business Strategy | publisher= McGraw-Hill/Irwin | year=2009| pages = 294–304 | isbn=978-0-07-337568-7}}</ref>
'''Controllable decisions in monopolistic competition'''
To simulate monopolistic competition, the controllable firm decisions of the participants (students) must include, at a minimum, those specified in the standard theoretical model, including (see Baye, 2009):<ref name="Baye"/> * Firm price * Advertising * Firm production * Plant Size
'''Simulation game experience'''
From an educational point of view, students will have an "opportunity" to learn by their own observations and experience through participation in a simulation game (see Schmidt, 2003).<ref name="Schmidt">{{cite journal | doi = 10.1080/00220480309595209 | author = Schmidt, Stephen J. | year = 2003| title = Active and cooperative learning using Web-based simulations | journal = Journal of Economics Education| volume = 34 | pages =151–167 | issue=2}}</ref> Consistent with the theoretical model of monopolistic competition (see Baye, 2009),<ref name="Baye"/> student participants would observe and experience that their pricing decisions are controlled by the market. They would "experience" that in the simulation they would have to lower their firm's price to be competitive as new firms entered the market. In the long-run, they would see the impact of changing plant size. They would observe that the successful firms would take advantage of economies of scale, but would also be careful not to incur [[diseconomies of scale]] in the long-run. Students would experience that economic profits cannot be maintained in the long-run. They would see, first hand, that their accounting profits will inevitably decline and move closer to normal profits. This experience provides students an opportunity to learn (as a supplement to the lecture and readings) the economic messages of monopolistic competition.
== Example in Macroeconomics == In 2018, Harvard Business Publishing published "Macroeconomics Simulation: Econland". This 30-minute simulation brings economic policymaking to life by allowing students to make monetary and fiscal policy decisions and consider their impact on the economy of a fictional country. Students manage the economy through a 7-year business cycle in an effort to maximize the approval rating from their population. Exploring the trade-offs of economic policy decision-making and the effects of the global economic environment on a country, students consolidate their understanding of core macroeconomic concepts, including GDP, unemployment, inflation, and budget deficit. At a deeper level, students develop critical thinking skills and learn about economic modeling and system dynamics. The simulation won a Silver Medal at the International Serious Play Awards.
==See also== *[[:Category:Economic simulation board games]] *[[Business game]] *[[Business simulation]] *[[Business simulation game]] *[[Game (simulation)]] *[[Government simulation game]] *[[Miniconomy]] *[[Training simulation]]

==References==

L., Boehlje, M., Erickson, S., and Taylor, R. (1995). Using Games to Teach Farm and Agribusiness Management, Review of Agricultural Economics, 17(3), 247-255. * Fritzche, D., and Cotter, R. (1990). Guidelines for Administering Business Games, in Guide to Business Gaming and Experiential Learning, edited by Gentry, J., ABSEL, Nichols/GP Publishing, East Brunswick, 74-89. * Gentry, J., ed., (1990), Guide to Business Gaming and Experiential Learning, ABSEL, Nichols/GP Publishing, East Brunswick. * Greenlaw, S.A. (1999). Using groupware to enhance teaching and learning in undergraduate economics, Journal of Economic Education, 30(winter), 33-42. * Lean, J., Moizer, M., Towler, C. A. (2006). Active Learning in Higher Education, Journal of Simulation and games, 7(3), 227-242. * McHaney, R., White, D., Heilman, G. E. (2002). Simulation Project Success and Failure: Survey Findings, Simulation & Gaming, 33(1), 49-66. * Mills, B.J. and Cottell, P.G. (1998), Cooperative learning for higher education faculty, Phoenix, Ariz.: Oryx Press * Simkins, S.P. (1999), Promoting active-student learning using the World Wide Web in economics courses, Journal of Economic Education, 30(Summer), 278-91.

page.title: The Ehrenberg-Bass Institute for Marketing Science

revision.comment: Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v2.0beta10)
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2016}} {{Use Australian English|date=October 2016}} The '''Ehrenberg-Bass Institute for Marketing Science''' is a [[marketing research]] [[institute]] within the [[University of South Australia|School of Marketing]] at the [[University of South Australia]] in [[Adelaide]], Australia. It is an independent, not-for-profit institute.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.communitypanel.com.au/teatreegully/teatreegully/about.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-07-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100502042944/http://www.communitypanel.com.au/teatreegully/teatreegully/about.html |archivedate=2 May 2010 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Previously named the Marketing Science Centre, it was elevated to institute status in 2005 after recognition of over a decade of achievements. It is the first university institute devoted to marketing science. To signal the Institute's research [[philosophy]] it was renamed after two marketing academics, Professor [[Andrew Ehrenberg]] and Professor [[Frank Bass]]. Both Ehrenberg and Bass have championed the development of simple generalised laws that can be described mathematically and can be widely applied.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.unisa.edu.au/ehrenberg-bass/about/history.asp |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-07-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091009175208/http://www.unisa.edu.au/ehrenberg-bass/about/history.asp |archivedate=9 October 2009 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
The Institute aims to uncover law-like patterns and relationships and build empirically grounded theory to explain and predict buyer behaviour and brand performance.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.unisa.edu.au/ehrenberg-bass/about/default.asp |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-07-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091009174624/http://www.unisa.edu.au/ehrenberg-bass/about/default.asp |archivedate=9 October 2009 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
The Institute Director is Professor [[Byron Sharp]] and it is governed by three Advisory Boards that meet annually to discuss research directions and key priorities. These are held in the United States, the United Kingdom and Australia.<ref>http://www.marketingscience.info/Advisory/BoardMembers.html{{Dead link|date=June 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref>
==Services provided==
===Corporate Sponsorship=== The Institute's research into marketing is sponsored by corporations such as The [[Coca-Cola Company]], [[Unilever]], [[Procter & Gamble]] and [[Turner Broadcasting]] through the Corporate Sponsorship Program.<ref>http://www.marketingscience.info/members/whojoins.htm{{Dead link|date=June 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref> This [[R&D]] program has been established to research some of the fundamental issues of marketing and [[buyer behaviour]].<ref>http://www1.lsbu.ac.uk/bus-ehrenberg/</ref> [[Empirical]] Generalisations have been established through this R&D program. The Institute's Corporate Sponsors receive discoveries in reports and in-house briefings.<ref>http://www.marketingscience.info/members/rd.html{{Dead link|date=June 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref>
===Contract Research=== Contract research is tailored to the client's specific needs and can be both [[qualitative research|qualitative]] and [[Quantitative research|quantitative]]. The Institute interprets raw data and draws [[logical consequence|implications]] for marketing strategy. Most aspects of market research can be undertaken at the Institute as there is an in-house computer-assisted telephone survey facility. The Institute also runs focus groups, in-depth interviews, on-line surveys and undertakes [[mystery shopping]] research. There are experts in the areas of [[brand]]ing, [[advertising]], [[Mass media|media]], [[buyer behaviour]], [[pricing]], [[sustainable]] marketing, wine marketing and service quality.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.unisa.edu.au/research/concentrations/docs/UNIVSA_EB_Brochure.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-07-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101203120457/http://unisa.edu.au/research/concentrations/docs/UNIVSA_EB_Brochure.pdf |archivedate=3 December 2010 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
===Community Panel=== The Ehrenberg-Bass Institute in conjunction with six South Australian councils established the Community Panel. The joint-initiative with The [[City of Tea Tree Gully]], [[City of Burnside]], [[City of Unley]], [[City of Holdfast Bay]], [[City of Campbelltown (South Australia)|City of Campbelltown]] and [[City of West Torrens]] has been set up to allow the local community to participate in the council's decision making process.<ref>http://www.communitypanel.com.au/</ref> The Institute establishes online surveys which are emailed to registered residents allowing them to participate. The response rate is around 90%.<ref>http://www.theaustralian.com.au/australian-it/councils-take-to-net/story-e6frgamf-1111116583981</ref> It provides a new opportunity for residents to express their thoughts, ideas and concerns.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.campbelltown.sa.gov.au/site/page.cfm?u=1594 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-07-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091112054941/http://www.campbelltown.sa.gov.au/site/page.cfm?u=1594 |archivedate=12 November 2009 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
===International Wine Marketing & Wine Tourism Database=== The Institute has established an online wine resource titled the International Wine Marketing & Wine Tourism Database. It is a [[bibliographic]] database that [[Bibliographic index|indexes]] and [[abstracts]] articles from published material on all aspects of the global wine industry. Documents include journal articles, books, government publications, research reports, statistical documents and conference papers.<ref>http://www.winesea.unisa.edu.au</ref>
==International collaboration==
===Wharton Business School=== The Institute Director Professor [[Byron Sharp]], co-hosted an advertising conference with [[Jerry Wind|Professor Yoram (Jerry) Wind]] from [[The Wharton School]] in the US in December 2008. The conference explored the digital revolution within advertising and how advertising may work in the future.<ref>http://www.adelaidenow.com.au/business/sa-business-journal/unisa-wharton-to-unlock-future-of-ads/story-e6fredel-1111118501884</ref> The event was attended by over 100 senior [[advertising professional]]s. The conference lead to a special edition of the [[Journal of Advertising Research]] which was released in June 2009.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thearf.org/assets/pubs-jar-preview-june-09?fbid=zS2wkz3MPck |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-07-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110724091713/http://www.thearf.org/assets/pubs-jar-preview-june-09?fbid=zS2wkz3MPck |archivedate=24 July 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The Institute is collaborating with The Wharton School's 'Future of Advertising' project and the [[Advertising Research Foundation]] in 2012 for a follow-up to the 2008 conference which will feature research on multi-media orchestrated advertising.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.marketingscience.info/people/ByronSharp.html#Byron |title=Archived copy |access-date=1 July 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100513022534/http://www.marketingscience.info/people/ByronSharp.html#Byron#Byron |archive-date=13 May 2010 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
==References==
{{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[http://www.marketingscience.info/about-us/ About the Ehrenberg-Bass Institute]
